comment: Harde professor in all of department KSU economics. I have a 96 month loan on my truck. Professor economics for four tests lectures between in lessons. Be make sure to bring books and studying very hard examinations for course this one. Sparse extra credit. Incredulous grammer corrections. Good very course was good but difficult it was in econ 1101

One of the best professors I've taken at KSU. Truly cares about student's needs and wants them to succeed. If you need a pathway to an A, he'll meet with you outside of class and create a crystal clear path. Hard not to respect the guy for all he's done outside of teaching either.

Best teacher ever. I learned a lot and I got an A. He is very easy to understand because he cuts the bull5h1t and is 100% relevant. Very easy A because he gives you a practice exam which look exactly like the real thing. Attendance is 10% of your grade and quizzes are 20%. I took his 8AM class, which was hard for me, but it was worth it!!!

Salisbury was one of the best professors I've taken at KSU. His lectures are very thorough, and easy to understand. They are also setup to where it's as easily understandable as possible. Will show up 1 hr before class and wait outside the room for additional help. Gives practice exams which are similar to the tests, and has help sessions. Take him
Amazing guy, and always there to help his students. He will do everything in class and on his own time to make sure you pass and learn.

Prof. Salisbury is by far the best professor at KSU. His teaching style is interactive and very engaging. He makes economics fun and gives great examples. He'll help you every step of the way. He holds review sessions before class and will meet with you for extra help no problem. He teaches the material very clearly, show up and you'll do great!

take it from someone who had to re-take ECON 2100 3 times, this professor is BY FAR the best professor for Microeconomics. His tests are almost identical to the study guides and quizzes. SO IF YOU STUDY THE QUIZZES AND THE STUDY GUIDES, you WILL make an A! I wish he taught all of the Econ classes.

Great professor! He's very funny and makes economics fun to learn! Skipping out on his class is a huge mistake. Attending class and having him teach you the lesson instead of you learning it by yourself makes the lesson so much more memorable and easy to understand! And the best part, all his tests are pretty easy (as long as you attended class)!

Great professor! Very funny, gives great visuals, gets you really engaged into the lesson, makes economics interesting and fun to learn, gives great help whenever you don't understand a certain topic! Make sure not to miss his classes, though. Attendance aids you with him, and students that do normally miss class don't end up with a great grade.

He really is an awesome teacher and very detailed. I took him fall of 2014 and i really enjoyed and learned actual information I can and will use in real life. Yes, the class is hard, but its not because of his teaching style or class format. The material is hard and there is no easy way around it. Read, go to class EACH day and STUDY, I got an A.

I had to take Econ twice, and the second time was worth it. I made a B out the class. All you have to do is come to class which is part of your grade, look over your notes, review the practice quizzes and exams before the exam and you will do fine in the class.

Best professor I've ever had. Don't miss an opportunity to take him!  He makes Global Economics interesting,  is entertaining, witty and full of knowledge.  He gives all the answers to his tests before you take them, so go to class and take notes & you'll get an A.  He also posts practice quizzes that will look just like his exams, so take them too

Lectures are interesting and entertaining. Professor Salisbury has a wonderful personality. Even if you hate economics you'll love this course. I learned alot from this professor and I'm sure you will too. Take him, you won't regret it. Best Econ professor.

Professor Salisbury makes Econ easy to understand, and his practice guides really help on the tests. He teaches in such a way that you learn the relevant information, and then tests you on exactly what he teaches. He really cares about you and is willing to invest in you both short term and long term. A great career coach, too. Best prof. yet!!!

Friday morning classes are a big mistake, but thankfully he always ended class about an hour early. His final is before Christmas break, which gets it out of the way so that you have more time to study for all of your other finals at the usual time. Just show up to class and sort of pay attention and you'll do fine. Also, TAKE THE PRACTICE QUIZZES.
Salisbury is awesome! Very motivating, very successful. His class was extremely enjoyable. I begged him to teach 2200 the following semester. I DEFINETLY recommend him.

Show up,  take the online quizzes, pay attention and remember examples given in class and you're golden! The book isn't required. He puts notes on D2L. Also it's important to watch the videosskim the power points he puts on D2L. Easy A!
Great economics teacher. If you do what he tells you on the first day of class you will get an A

Professor Salisbury is the best teacher I have ever had. He will make time to tutor you outside of class. He tells you exactly what to study to make an A in his class. All the material is there for you - all you need to do is open it up. You will not find a more clear, helpful professor anywhere. He is the best. I would take him again and again.

Prof. Salisbury really cares about the success of all of his students. His lectures keep your attention as he is big on student participation. You do work for the grade you receive, but an A is very easy to obtain in his class. Just show up & study. PP & test questionsanswers posted online to review. 2 free absences in his Hybrid class

Best teacher I have ever had! There was nothing I disliked about this guy. Class attendance is 10% of your grade but it is worth it. Lectures are very interesting, very clear, and perfectly relevant to what is on the tests. He is also a career coach  for economics and finance. In addition, he has had so much business experience in the past.
AMAZING PROFESSOR!!! Extremely clear and easy to learn from. TAKE HIM YOU WONT REGRET IT!!!

He is amazing! Absolutely take him for Global Economics. He gives example tests to practice as well as all of his Micro quizzes (not for grades). He knows how to make the material easy to understand and keeps it interesting. Doesn't hurt he runs his own investment firm. Come to class, do the practice tests and quizzes, easiest A ever.

Great teacher...knows his stuff, researches the answer if he doesn't know it off the top of his head. Very keen on helping his students succeed. You'll learn a lot and be able to get a great grade-just attend class, pay attention to powerpts and lectures.

Professor Salisbury is the the main reason I switched majors. I am literally going out of my way and taking a Saturday class just to have him again. Loves his students, and genuinely wants to help them succeed. He gives you more than enough tools to get a good grade, and makes the topic interesting and understandable. Favorite professor, easily.

I took him over the summer for econ 1100 on saturdays. Brilliant professor! He makes class interested, shares videos to keep it practical and will work with you so you actually understand economics. Go to class, read powerpoints & you'll do well. I didnt use textbook and I got an A
fantastic teacher. he really cares about his job.

Prof.Salisbury is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He loves the subject and knows how to get the class involved. He makes econ really interesting, gives lots of real life examples, and cares about his students. His tests aren't hard as long as you read the power point, come to class and pay attention.I highly recommend taking him.

I took his hybrid course on fridays. He was awesome! I had no interest in economics before or really after the class but he made my general education requirement completely bearable and interesting during the semester. I would definitely recommend him to anyone. He was really nice and the work isn't hard. Study his power points = you'll pass.

Passionate about what he does, and will stay and study with students if they need help. Makes you want to know more about Economics, and encourages his students to use business language when answering questions but will never pressure you if you can't answer the question. One of the best teachers.

By far one of the finest professors I have come by throughout my 3 years at kennesaw state. His class is designed to be practical and the material is actually USEFUL. His class is enjoyable and he provides you with everything you need to be successful in his class. Would highly recommend. Kennesaw state is lucky to have him!

LOVED this class. This was my 3rd time taking econ, not because I am stupid but because it just doesn't come easy to me. I got an A. All exam questions come from previous quizzes. Really fun, caring teacher who knows a lot. Mandatory attendance but you will want to go. TAKE HIM.

He was awesome! I learned more about Economics in one semester than I have my entire life. He had a way of explaining things that really showed he cared and wanted you to do well. Attendance is mandatory, you do not need the book. An A or B is a given if you attend class and give it your best.

He was an awesome professor! I would recommend him to anyone. I took the Hybrid class. Although attendance is mandatory, the tests and assigned weekly open-note quizzes, are very easy. I hate economics but this class was easy. He is a very nice guy who knows his material very well.

I took the Hybrid class.  This professor is one of my favorites.  He keeps the class interested, covers the material in detail and different ways to help clarify it. He also answers emails quickly and provides study sessions if necessary. No need to purchase the textbook, just attend class, study the power points and the quizzes, and do the work.
I did the Hybrid 1100 course; Take him. DO NOT BUY TEXTBOOK. I learned a lot!
Love him! This professor is smart, funny and designs the course to be very helpful and interesting. Very cool guy.

Professor is absolutely AMAZING!  He teaches through the Socratic Method of teaching so he is constantly asking questions to the students and engages us in the lesson.  You do NOT need to buy the book for his course.  He feeds it to you through D2L.  Just take the practice quizzes, go over the powerpoints and videos and you  will get an A.

He is awesome and HILARIOUS. I took this class as a hybrid. Quizzes are online,attendance is 10 percent of your grade so if you don't miss more than 2 classes you get a 100 for attendance. Exams are pretty easy if you study the quizzes and what he talked about in class. Only 3 exams. Did not have to buy the book either. I made an A in the class.

Salisbury is an excellent teacher! Go to class, take the quizzes, do the work, and you will get an A. (I took his hybrid class). I went into it dreading the semester, I have no interest in economics, and I am horrible at math. Salisbury teaches in a way that makes it easy to learn. Do not buy the book, I did not open it once and got an A!

Salisbury is really intelligent, but humble about it and helpful. Just take the quizzes, attend all the classes, and you'll do fine. 3 tests, each worth 30% of your grade, attendance is 10%. each test was like 25-30 MC questions. he's fair and entertaining.

Take him!You are allowed to miss 2 classes,but then why would you? His class is never boring.I took the Saturday class and never regretted it. He uses name cards to identify his students and he is very helpful.He replies emails on time too. If you want to pass this class, review all the power points and videos; take the practice quizzes also

Professor Salisbury is Awesome!! He made the material very easy and even interesting to learn and he is always willing to help his students, not matter his opportunity cost. Take him you wont regret it!!!
Awesome professor!!! Explains everything clearly, and really wants you to succeed in his class. Go to class, pay attention, do the test reviews and you'll come out with an A!!

He made every lecture somewhat interesting. He jovially picked on random students in the lecture hall to get his point across. He used a lot of good analogies and his assignments to look at before taking the quizes couldn't be laid out any simpler than they are. If you watch the videos, look at the power points, and go to class you'll pass.
Professor Salisbury is by far the best professor I have ever had. He is fair and dedicated to his students. If you put in the effort, you will get an A or B. Take his class!!!

Professor Salisbury is by far one of the most knowledgeable professors in his field. The guy has a Harvard MBA which is amazing.Always stayed after class for people who are struggling. Took him on a saturday. Highly recommend him for people who are going into business. Hes so clear of what he wants, and he really cares about his students. Love him!

If you have to take econ, TAKE HIM. 3 tests, but he gives examples, practice tests, previous tests, etc. Just go to class, read the powerpoints, watch the vids he posts to D2L. He has a non mandatory review session before each test, and it helps so much. You can tell he genuinely loves to teach and make sure his students understand. 5/5
Good professor and good listener always looking for ways to help his students. i will recommend him to anybody.

Make sure you go to every class and you will do great. He is very clear about what you need to know and goes over material thoroughly. You have to be really lazy to not do well in his class. He sets you up for success the whole semester!

I would recommend this professor to any student! Professor Salisbury stayed with a group of us for over an hour on multiple occasions to make sure we understood the material. He responds to emails very quickly. If you manage to do poorly in his class then you probably didn't put in any effort because all the information is there for you. I got an A

Great professor, very fair and helpful.  Three tests and attendance grade, doesn't leave you much room to mess up but tests are easy. No more than 30 quesions.  Don't need the book, he gives you everything. I would recommend.

I can confidently say Professor Salisbury is one of the finest instructors I have ever had the pleasure of studying under. He is incredibly knowledgeable, dedicated and willing to engage every student. Highly, highly recommended.
I took his hybrid class which was later in the day on Friday, but soooo worth it. He's such a great teacher. You actually learn and getting a B is very very very easy. But effort is needed for an A.

Professor Salisbury is the best. For such a boring subject, he keeps the students interested with thoughtful examples and posts EVERYTHING on D2L. He responds to emails very quickly and will meet with you outside of office hours to help with the material. He is funny and extremely upbeat. I took him on a Saturday morning and refused to miss class.

The professor made learning the course material fun, interesting and easier. His use of powerpoints and videos made the material come to life rather than just relying on the textbook. If more information were needed you could email him and his response turn around time was always an hour maybe less. He would meet for appointments whenever needed.

Professor Salisbury is AWESOME!Econ2100 taught by him delivers the material in a way all students can understand. His use of powerpoints and videos give fun and current examples we can all relate to which in tone helps to understnad the material. It's more benefical then reading from a textbook. I would definitely take another course of his.
Gave lots of study information. Attendance is not required but is part of the grade. If you watched the power points and videos and reviewed the information given you will succeed in class.

Prof. Salisbury is the best Econ teacher! he's very passionate about what he teaches. His instructions are very clear and organized. He's also very helpful and responsive to emails. If you come to class and read the power points an A shouldn't be hard to obtain. I highly recommend him!

Prof. Salisbury is one of the best teacher I've came across.  I took this class hybrid, his instructions were very clear and organized. He's also very helpful and responsive with emails. As long as you read the power points and watch the videos you will DEFINITELY get an A in his class. I would highly recommend him because he's the best!!

Arguably the best Econ Professor you'll have at KSU! Seriously! The guy is a total genius in his field I absolutely wished he taught me all my classes! He is comical, interactive and very helpful. He teaches with great clarity and insight and motivates you to want to learn Econ. SCI 1101 puts me to sleep this one keeps me awake! Literally! :-0

Professor Joshua is AWESOME!! I enjoy and I'm learning a lot. He cares about his students and wanting them to succeed. Everything is posted on D2L, Points are given for attendance and he meets after class if needed. His life stories are amazing and he knows his stuff. Study Power Points and take notes.You can do well in his class.

Helpful prof who really seems to enjoy teaching and mentoring students. Gives very clear expectations and communicates well. Engages the class to keep lectures interesting and patiently reviews concepts until they are understood. He will even offer extra help if needed. He is able to make economics accessible and interesting to a Gen-Ed class.

Professor Salisbury is an Economist. His life of experience and career experience as an Economist brings a lot of "real world" knowledge to the table. He is brilliant, pleasant, helpful, courteous and cares about the success of his students. If you truly want to understand Economics, you will be hard pressed to find a better teacher!

GREAT TEACHER! I loved his class because he took the extra time to make sure everybody in class understands the material. He uses the power points provided by the book manufacturer and posts them online so no need to purchase the book!

To describe Mr. Salisbury as an amazing professor would be an understatement. He wishes the best for the students and pushes them to succeed even outside of his classroom. As he tells you the first day, the class is easy as long as you go to class, read the book, and review the PowerPoints. I would definitely recommend him!

Absolutely a great professor. I would take him again in a heartbeat. Salisbury will do everything he can to help you succeed. He is very easygoing, and keeps you interested with some witty humor. He learns everyone's names and does cold-call, which I found very helpful. He did a very good job at making microeconomics interesting and attainable.

This class is for students who really want to succeed. Prof. Salisbury is passionate about teaching and knows what it takes to do well. If you are willing to study, take his class - you can get a good grade. Unfortunately, he does cold call students, and attendance is mandatory, but his lectures are fun and engaging.

Great Professor! Very much interested in your success, both in and out of the classroom. Keeps the mood light and interesting during class. Very knowledgeable and fair. Read the book, power points, and attend class and an "A" is definitely possible!

Salisbury does a great job of explaining things in various wasy to ensure overall comprehension. If you go to class and review the powerpoints before the tests, you should have no problem earning an "A".

I really wish he taught more that Econ 2100. I would definitely take him for 2200. Anywho, he's a great professor. I missed a class and he went back through all the information I missed and took about an extra hour to expllain everything. He really cares about your success!

Great professor! Keeps you interested with real life examples that makes everything much easier to relate to and more so he cares about your success. I'd definitely take more of his classes in the future.

Great professor. Grade based off 2 tests, 1 final, and attendance. As long as you show up to class, pay attention, and review power points before the tests, it is an easy A. I never even opened the book... He did a great job relaying ALL the important information.
This professor knows his micro economic.  he makes a complex subject simple to understand and apply.  Take this professor if you need an A in micro-economics

Excellent professor. Goes above and beyond expectations to clearly teach the class. Works diligently to ensure the class understands the concepts by providing relavent examples and real life applications of the material. Highly qualified to teach the subject. Breathes life into the subject making economics understandable, relavant, and enjoyable.
Highly recommended! If you dont like economics but have to take it, take this professor!!
Great professor! Keeps you interested, cares about your success, interesting person. If you dont do well its your own fault.

Excellent professor!  Economics, though important, can be rather dry--especially microeconomics.  But, he makes sure that every single person understands in class with interesting examples from real life as well as his experience from Harvard.  Very helpful: takes time out for questions and also have ample office hours available if you need it.
Very pleasant and knowledgable professor. Your grade is based on 3 tests: 2 midterms and 1 final. It is imperative to keep up and read the chapters as tests are given on multiple chapters at a time.

He really is a great professor. Sometimes he goes a little fast but makes sure everyone understands the material. He grades fair. He tends to get off topic at times and really likes to talk about himself. I would definitely recommend  him. Best advice for this class: show up and read the book.
